article.headline: Montana 80, Montana State 64
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) -- The Montana Grizzlies withstood a couple of hot-shooting runs by Montana State until they could put together a string of their own in beating their rival 80-64 Saturday afternoon. "The game's got a lot of ebb and flow," said UM coach Larry Krystkowiak. "Our guys stayed the course." Matt Dlouhy scored a career high 19 points and held Montana State's leading scorer Ja'Ron Jefferson to eight points on 3-of-11 shooting -- half his season average. "I thought they defended us very well," said MSU coach Mick Durham. "They pushed us out on the perimeter and didn't give us many looks in transition." Backup point guard Bryan Ellis scored all 12 of his points in the final 11 minutes to spark the final rally for Montana (13-2, 3-0 Big Sky). Casey Durham led Montana State (9-8, 2-1) with 17 points, including a 3-pointer with 15:45 remaining that gave the Bobcats a 47-40 lead. MSU had made 83 percent of its second-half shots at that point, before Dlouhy and Ellis keyed a 19-4 run. Dlouhy hit a 3-pointer to pull Montana within 44-47 with 12:41 remaining. His put-back at the 11:29 mark drew the Grizzlies within 48-50. Ellis made two free throws with 10:57 remaining to tie the score at 50. He then stole the ball from Durham and made a layup six seconds later. Ellis again stole the ball from Durham on the next possession. He was fouled on his layup attempt, but made both free throws to give the Grizzlies a 54-50 lead with 10:42 to play. "I thought Ellis made a great play on the first steal," said coach Durham. "And on the second, Casey got lackadaisical. Watching as a coach and a father, that was a tough stretch." Another 3-pointer by Dlouhy ended the run with Montana leading 59-51 with 9:29 remaining. "I hadn't done much lately, so I'm sure they weren't worried about me," said Dlouhy, who scored 11 points above his season average. The Bobcats got back within 61-57 on two free throws by Nick Dissly with 7:45 to play. A put-back by Jordan Hasquet and a 3-pointer by Dlouhy gave Montana a 66-57 lead with 5:46 remaining. Casey Durham was fouled on a long 3-pointer and made all three free throws as the Bobcats pulled within 66-60 with 5:32 remaining. UM outscored MSU 14-4 the rest of the way, winning its first regular season Cat-Griz game in Bozeman in six years. Ellis had another steal in the final minutes, stripping the ball away at half court with a clear layup. But he passed the ball to Virgil Matthews whose dunk made the score 73-62. Matthews finished with 11 points, seven assists and five steals. Montana made 7-of-8 free throws in the final 1:57, including six by Ellis, who also had three assists and four steals. "They came out with fire and we came out with nothing," said Montana State forward Marvin Moss, who finished with 14 points, but struggled with a 6-of-12 effort from the free throw line. Montana forward Andrew Strait scored 12 of his 16 points in the first half, as the Grizzlies rallied from an early 16-7 deficit. Strait hit two free throws to give Montana its first lead at 26-25. Another basket by Strait put the Griz up 30-29 with 1:58 left in the half. Casey Durham hit a 3-pointer with 1:46 to play and two free throws after a steal with 39 second to play to put the Bobcats up 34-30 at halftime. Kevin Criswell added 10 points for Montana, but the 82 percent free throw shooter made just 3-of-8 free throws.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
